I had this exact pain around a week ago when I changed my routine. I took some ibuprofen to avoid inflammation based on a doctor's recommendation, and used some arnica cream, which is made out of herbs and helps with muscle and joint pain. I still kept on working out every other day and it passed after 5 or 6 days
According to research, patients should complete a course of 100-120mg of accutane per kilogram. I got clear a month and a half in and still need to complete 6 months

I started making tuna balls I brown some onions, add in red bell pepper and shredded carrot. Mix in the tuna and some egg to make it moist. Season to liking with salt pepper and parsley, stuck in the oven for half an hour. Easy, fast, filling, cheap, healthy! Love it. They turn out pretty moist too!
I got with my friend 3 weeks after ending a 7 year relationship. Best decision I ever made. I might be the odd one here though haha

Of course. Whatever you can think of, accutane can dry it. I had a bloody nose once or twice but nothing major. The problem solved when I started applying whatever I used on my kips, in my nose. Aquaphor, bepanthene, whatever it was... Now no issues
How much to you weigh? Have you seen some improvement or none at all?
Sorry, but what's SL app?
I've actually experienced it during my entire treatment, funny u didn't see the connection.. Basically I blush like a freaking tomato very easily. And when I work out I get very red

Something you should be aware of is that research shows that to achieve long term results, and not get acne back, you should reach 100-120 mg of accutane per kilogram. You can divide that in a few months or more. For me personally it is exactly 40mg for 6 months. This is considered an average dosage, not too high or too low. Everybody reacts very differently to accutane. For me, dry lips and arms. Hair and face stopped being a greasy mess and became normal to somewhat dry. Sometimes dry eyes, and once in a while dry nose with a bit of bleeding. I had mild acne, which is why I only started taking accutane in my twenties, after nothing worked for about yen years. I'm now entering my sixth month, and the results have been amazing. I had a very fast improvement and haven't had a zit since a month and a half in! Good luck, feel free to PM me

Are you taking accutane? If you are, you must stop all kinds of topicals, and anything you use for treating acne! Your routine should be as if you were taking care of a baby- mild soap like cetaphil, moisturizer, and sunscreen.

To be honest the only think that helped my acne was accutane. I know many people don't want to take it.. I say be as gentle as you can to your skin. Use mild things, try the beginner's routine from here
I had oily acne prone skin, and the three step system was horrible for me! Don't let them talk you into it... Do what you know is better for you, be gentle to your skin
Active ingredient is the same: isotretinoin. I took a generic one and got amazing results. Good luck!!

A few weeks ago I started making green smoothies! Decided to buy a cheap blender and try it out, couldn't be happier! My favorite so far: 2 cups of spinach, 1 big carrot, half a red apple, half a banana, low fat yogurt. So creamy with the yogurt, tastes very good. I sweeten with some stevia, you could also de agave or honey if you need more sweetness. I usually drink this smoothie every day now. I just froze some bananas and apples already cut into portions- this makes a very cold and refreshing smoothie and assures you won't be out of ripe bananas! Give it a go
30 lbs in a month? Wow!! What was your starting weight/height?
I adore acne.org moisturizer... From www.acne.org
I adore acne.org moisturizer... From www.acne.org

I remember during the first month all the whiteheads on my chin and nose started sticking out like little worms. My skin looked like it could brush somebody's hair! Went away and since then... Not one clogged pore!!! Just patience my friend!

Don't pop or pick at anything! When on accutane, they heal faster anyway. Your skin is very sensitive now, so doing anything to your pimples would be a very bad idea. Before accutane you probably would have applied some sort of topical- so imagine that right now you are putting on the best topical that you can... Except for you're taking it orally. I never picked it my skin, and wore sunscreen, now during my fifth month accutane everything faded away, you can't even tell I once had acne!

WRITING.TITLE: Had a nice victory today (during fifth month of accutane)
WRITING.TEXT: I was at the gym, doing some arm exercises, looking in the mirror. I looked at my skin, admired how great it looked and wondered, "which foundation am I wearing today?" Well, in fact, I was not wearing foundation, just rolled out of bed in the morning and went straight to the gym. Yay accutane!!

I've made it a point during my entire course to take accutane along with something fatty. The one time I didn't, just ate a salad before, I got a stomach ache.. A very unpleasant one. Also as mentioned before, you need fats for the accutane to absorb properly. Of course there's no need to go crazy, just make sure there's something there, chicken, avocado, oil, milk or whatever
Wear sunscreen so at least you won't get extra long term pigmentation..
MUFE pro finish powder. Cakes, oxidizes like crazy, when nt skin was oily it made it worse..
Sorry, what'd BCAA?

My ex, 7 years together. We were looking at apartments to move in together finally (I was 21) and I also caught him looking for engagement rings a few tines.. Then he Suddenly wanted out ... Obviously turned out he was cheating with a 17 year old girl (he was 24) and they moved in together less than a week after we broke up..
I think don't go overboard, it can be too much... Do simple things. A foot rub and nice music, prepare a nice bubble bath for her, cook some dinner, etc.
